text: Mohamed Hassanein Heikal (23 September 1923 – 17 February 2016) was an Egyptian journalist. For 17 years (1957–1974), he was editor-in-chief of the Cairo newspaper Al-Ahram. He was a commentator on Arab affairs for more than 50 years.There isn't a target in Afghanistan worth a $1m missile - Mohamed Heikal, the Arab world's foremost political commentator, Guardian, Stephen Moss, October 10, 2001 He was born in Cairo, Egypt. Heikal died in Cairo, Egypt from renal failure on 17 February 2016. He was aged 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Various articles, Al-Ahram Weekly Category:1923 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:Egyptian journalists Category:Writers from Cairo
title: Mohamed Hassanein Heikal
